title: HomeRobot: Open-Vocabulary Mobile Manipulation. (arXiv:2306.11565v2 [cs.RO] UPDATED)
abstract: HomeRobot (noun): An affordable compliant robot that navigates homes and manipulates a wide range of objects in order to complete everyday tasks. Open-Vocabulary Mobile Manipulation (OVMM) is the problem of picking any object in any unseen environment, and placing it in a commanded location. This is a foundational challenge for robots to be useful assistants in human environments, because it involves tackling sub-problems from across robotics: perception, language understanding, navigation, and manipulation are all essential to OVMM. In addition, integration of the solutions to these sub-problems poses its own substantial challenges. To drive research in this area, we introduce the HomeRobot OVMM benchmark, where an agent navigates household environments to grasp novel objects and place them on target receptacles. HomeRobot has two components: a simulation component, which uses a large and diverse curated object set in new, high-quality multi-room home environments; and a real-world co

Title: HomeRobot: Open-Vocabulary Mobile Manipulation. (arXiv:2306.11565v2 [cs.RO] UPDATED)
Abstract: HomeRobot (noun): An affordable compliant robot that navigates homes and manipulates a wide range of objects in order to complete everyday tasks. Open-Vocabulary Mobile Manipulation (OVMM) is the problem of picking any object in any unseen environment, and placing it in a commanded location. This is a foundational challenge for robots to be useful assistants in human environments, because it involves tackling sub-problems from across robotics: perception, language understanding, navigation, and manipulation are all essential to OVMM. In addition, integration of the solutions to these sub-problems poses its own substantial challenges. To drive research in this area, we introduce the HomeRobot OVMM benchmark, where an agent navigates household environments to grasp novel objects and place them on target receptacles. translated_title: HomeRobot: 开放词汇移动操作
translated_abstract: HomeRobot(noun): 一种价格合理的顺应力机器人，可在家庭中导航并操纵各种物体，以完成日常任务。开放词汇移动操作（OVMM）是在任何未知环境中捡起任何物体并放置在指定位置的问题。对于机器人要成为人类环境中有用的助手，这是一个基础性的挑战，因为它涉及到机器人学中的各个子问题：感知、语言理解、导航和操纵都是OVMM的关键。此外，将这些子问题的解决方案集成起来也面临着自己的巨大挑战。为推动这一领域的研究，我们推出了HomeRobot OVMM基准测试，其中一个智能体在家庭环境中导航，以捡起新奇物体并放置在目标容器上。HomeRobot具有两个组件：一个仿真组件，使用新的高质量多房间家庭环境中的大量和多样化的物体集合; 和一个实际的物理机器人组件，用于在真实世界中进行测试和验证。
tldr: HomeRobot是一种开放词汇移动操作的顺应力机器人，可在家庭环境中导航并操纵各种物体，以完成日常任务。它引入了HomeRobot OVMM基准测试，通过仿真和实际机器人两个组件进行测试和验证。
en_tdlr: HomeRobot is an affordable compliant robot that navigates homes and manipulates a wide range of objects to complete everyday tasks. It introduces the HomeRobot OVMM benchmark for testing and validation, which includes simulation and real-world robot components.
